newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Dec 4.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Dec 4.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:
Multimedia group due to make debut on Australian Stock Exchange at 11.00 a.m. (2400 GMT). Early bid/ask of A$2.12/A$2.40 compares with issue price of A$2.00 per share.
On Tuesday, minerals explorer said it had encountered a major gas zone in the first well drilled in the Morrow gas play in Texas, USA.

Perth-based computer group launched its Richter Paradigm Computer and its "Neurocard" in the U.S. on Tuesday. The share price plunged locally on a combination of profit takers after strong rises in recent months and rumours the launch had not gone well, according to the Australian Financial Review. The company said in August it planned to list on the NASDAQ market in the US.

National Australia Bank Ltd is rumoured to have recently bought Advance shares as part of its preparation to block the merger of the two Sydney-based regional banks. NAB is the largest shareholder in St George and is likely to bid for the smaller bank sometime next year, according to analysts.

Shares in the transport group rise to match the offer price by Holland's KPN Nederland as fund managers rush to accept the takeover before it closes in mid-December. TNT stock continues to dominate the turnover list.
